sponsor: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)
briefTitle: Pivotal Phase 2b/3 ALVAC/Bivalent gp120/MF59 HIV Vaccine Prevention Safety and Efficacy Study in South Africa
officialTitle: A Pivotal Phase 2b/3 Multisite, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of ALVAC-HIV (vCP2438) and Bivalent Subtype C gp120/MF59 in Preventing HIV-1 Infection in Adults in South Africa
summary: This study will evaluate the preventive vaccine efficacy, safety, and tolerability of ALVAC-HIV (vCP2438) + Bivalent Subtype C gp120/MF59 in HIV-seronegative South African adults over 24 months and potentially up to 36 months from enrollment.

primaryOutcome.measure: Incidence Rate of HIV-1 Infection Diagnosed After Enrollment (Concurrent With First Vaccination) Through 24 Months After Enrollment
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Measured through 24 months after first vaccination
